text.p: Headlines from major national newspapers. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
EL PAIS
- Unions expand the December 11 strike to airports and television stations
- High Court chief prosecutor pressures Liano to close the "Lasa-Zabala case"
- Truckers' blockade causes problems for the Spanish automobile sector
- The government won't take action against Cuba, waits for EU position
- Germany sends 250 million to "repair" the bombing of 1937
EL MUNDO
- Spain will not take any repressive measure against Cuba and will name another ambassador
- The first digital television platform is formed in Spain
- San Millan neighbours refuse to have the assassin buried there
- Volkswagen forces Arriortua to resign to reach an accord with General Motors
- Spanish economy has lost tens of billions due to the French truckers' strike
DIARIO 16
- Industry and rural Spain, asphyxiated by the French strike
ABC
- The French truckers' strike causes Spain losses of more than 100 billion
CINCO DIAS
- Pryca: the supplier that accepts discounts will be a well-treated friend; those that resist risk the chain store not taking care of them
- The bourse in 400 and in fashion
- Welfare goes to the bank in order to pay
- The airlines hit exports; impose tax of 13 pesetas/kilo
EXPANSION
- The bourse breaks 400
- D-11: the civil servants lead the first mass protest against Aznar's policies
- France Telecom will be the partner of Endesa and BCH in the "Retevision project"
GACETA DE LOS NEGOCIOS
- "Superlopez" forms his own company in order to leave Volkswagen
- 10 television channels for 2,500 pesetas a month, from March
- Villar Mir buys Huarte to make the sixth (biggest) construction group
